msg.rs_ctr2.decode_img: §bDecoding file as image with %sd bits per pixel ...
msg.rs_ctr2.encode_img: §bEncoding file as %sdx%sd image with %sd bits per pixel ...
msg.rs_ctr2.dir_invalid: §4To protect you from accidentally corrupting game files or other important data, you can not export to files outside the "rs_ctr2/memory/" directory.
gui.rs_ctr2.fmt_w:
Image width
§7for .png export
Bytes per line
§7for .hex export
advancements.rs_ctr2.microblocks.desc: Cut a block into bits using a Microblock Workbench.
advancements.rs_ctr2.replicate.desc: Build a Microblock Structure and replicate it 16 times using the Microblock Workbench.
advancements.rs_ctr2.io.desc: Communicate with the outside world via readers and emitters.
advancements.rs_ctr2.probe.desc: Use a Gate Probe to see what your circuit is doing.
advancements.rs_ctr2.arithmetic.desc: Finally I can do basic math!
advancements.rs_ctr2.energy.desc: Solar Cells and Batteries can supply energy to your Microblocks.
advancements.rs_ctr2.logistics.desc: Transport items and fluids through your Microblocks.
advancements.rs_ctr2.block_io.desc: Block Interaction Ports let machines like Block Breaker act on blocks further away.
advancements.rs_ctr2.block_io2.desc: Interaction Pipe Drivers give you a movable block target.
advancements.rs_ctr2.machine.desc: Reaches full potential when used with remote block interaction devices.
advancements.rs_ctr2.autocraft.desc: One machine to rule all the recipes!
advancements.rs_ctr2.frames.desc: Random Block Access Controllers are much easier to control but also more expensive.
item.rs_ctr2.logic_in.tip: §a⏴§7[t+1] = -1 (all bits high) if received external redstone signal > 0, otherwise 0.
item.rs_ctr2.logic_out.tip: Emits an external redstone signal of 15 if §9⏴§7 ≠ 0 (any bit high), otherwise emits 0.
item.rs_ctr2.analog_out.tip:
Emits an external redstone signal equal to §9⏴§7.
Signals outside 0..15 are possible!
item.rs_ctr2.splitter.tip: Repeats its data input to its 5 outputs.
item.rs_ctr2.constant.tip: §a⏵§7 = number set in GUI (interact with block).
item.rs_ctr2.clock.tip:
§a⏵§7 switches between 0 and -1 every §9⏴§7 ticks,
pausing if §9⏴§7 < 0 and resets (§a⏵§7 = 0) if §9⏴§7 = 0.
item.rs_ctr2.sr_latch.tip:
bitwise: if §9⏷§7 high then §A⏵§7[t+1] = low
else if §9⏶§7 high then §A⏵§7[t+1] = high
else §A⏵§7[t+1] = §A⏵§7[t]
§a⏴§7 = NOT §A⏵§7, initial §A⏵§7§9⏷⏶§7 = 0.
item.rs_ctr2.fluid_io.tip: §b⏴§7 provides the fluid storage of an external block.
item.rs_ctr2.power_io.tip: §e⏴§7 provides the energy storage of an external block.
item.rs_ctr2.item_io.tip:
§f⏴§7 provides the inventory of an external block or entity 
for slots §9⏷§7 to §9⏶§7 inclusive.
Initial §9⏷§7 = 0, §9⏶§7 = 255.
item.rs_ctr2.transformer.tip:
§a⏵§7 = RF/tick transferred from §e⏷§7 to §e⏶§7.
Power transfer is limited to §9⏴§7[t-1] RF/tick (can be negative).
Initial §9⏴§7 = 0.
item.rs_ctr2.battery.tip:
Adjacent cells combine.
§e⏺§7 (use power cable) provides energy storage.
§a⏺§7 (use data cable) outputs stored RF.
item.rs_ctr2.fluid_splitter.tip: Re-provides a used fluid storage 5 times.
item.rs_ctr2.fluid_mover.tip:
When any bit in §9-⏶§7[t-1] transitions low to high, it tries to transfer §9⏶-§7[t-1] mB of fluid from §b⏴§7 to §b⏵§7, consuming energy from §e⏵§7 and outputs the actually transferred amount to §a⏴§7.
Initial §9⏶-§7 = 1000.
item.rs_ctr2.item_mover.tip:
When any bit in §9-⏶§7[t-1] transitions low to high, it tries to transfer §9⏶-§7[t-1] items from §f⏴§7 to §f⏵§7, consuming energy from §e⏵§7 and outputs the actually transferred amount to §a⏴§7.
Initial §9⏶-§7 = 64.
item.rs_ctr2.power_splitter.tip: Re-provides a used energy storage 5 times.
item.rs_ctr2.bit_shift.tip: §a⏵§7[t+1] = §9⏴§7 binary shifted left by §9⏶§7 bits (can be negative).
item.rs_ctr2.solarcell.ext:
Peak power: %sd RF/cell every 8 ticks
Integrated sun time: %s.3f
item.rs_ctr2.solarcell.tip:
Harvests energy from sunlight.
Must be placed in top layer, adjacent cells combine.
§e⏺§7 use power cable for power output.

§a3: §e%sd RF§7 available energy
§a4: §fcan pull items: %ss
§a5: §fcan push items: %ss

§a0: §c0x%s08X§7 State
§91: §c%sd§7 Input
§92: §c%sd§7 OFF threshold
§93: §c%sd§7 ON threshold
state.rs_ctr2.mem_read:
§a0: §c0x%sX %s1$d§7 value
§81: Memory
§92: §c0x%s04X %s2$d§7 address
§93: §c%sd§7 bits per word
state.rs_ctr2.mem_write:
§80: Memory
§91: §c0x%sX %s1$d§7 value
§92: §c0x%s04X %s2$d§7 address
§93: §c%sd§7 bits per word
item.rs_ctr2.counter.tip:
When any bit in §9⏷§7[t-1] transitions low to high then §A⏵§7 increments by one. §A⏵§7 resets to 0 if ≥ §9⏴§7[t-1].
§A⏶§7 = §9⏷§7[t-1] if §A⏵§7 = 0 AND §9⏴§7[t-1] > 0 otherwise §A⏶§7 = 0.
item.rs_ctr2.mem_read.tip:
§a⏶§7[t+1] = read word of size §9⏴§7 bits at index §9⏷§7 in memory §8⏵§7.
A read happens @ t+½ when §9⏷§7 or §9⏴§7 changed and §9⏴§7 ≠ 0.
§4Word size must be a power of two or results are undefined!
item.rs_ctr2.mem_write.tip:
Writes §9⏶§7 as word of size §9⏴§7 bits to index §9⏷§7 in memory §8⏵§7.
A write happens @ t+1 when §9⏶§7, §9⏷§7 or §9⏴§7 changed and §9⏴§7 ≠ 0.
When multiple writes to the same 32 bit block of the same memory happen in the same tick, only one will succeed!
§4Word size must be a power of two or results are undefined!
item.rs_ctr2.memory.tip:
Stores data that can be read and written by connected §6Memory Reader§7s and §6Writer§7s.
Content can be viewed by interacting.
Adjacent cells combine.
§4Removing cells or merging structures may cause data loss!
item.rs_ctr2.block_splitter.tip: Re-provides a used block interaction 5 times.

§90: §c0x%s08X§7 Crafting Clock
§91: §c0x%s08X§7 Low 2x3 Pattern

§a6: §e%sd RF§7 available energy

§a3: §fcan restock hand: %ss
§a4: §5%ss
state.rs_ctr2.solar:
Generating %sd RF / 8 ticks
§a0: §e%sd RF§7 storable energy
item.rs_ctr2.and_filter.tip: §A⏵§7 = §9⏴§7 AND number set in GUI (interact with block).
item.rs_ctr2.led.tip:
Lights up if §9⏵§7 ≠ 0.
Interact with dye to change color.
item.rs_ctr2.switch_array.tip:
§a⏵§7 = binary number represented by switches.
Interact with Switch Arrays on the sides to extend.
item.rs_ctr2.led_array.tip:
Displays §9⏵§7 in binary.
Interact with Lamp Arrays on the sides to extend.
Interact with dye to change color.
item.rs_ctr2._7segment.tip:
Displays §9⏵§7 as hexadecimal number (see §6BCD-Converter§7).
Interact with Displays on the sides to extend.
Interact with dye to change color.
item.rs_ctr2.bcd_converter.tip:
§a⏵§7 = §9⏴§7 converted to "binary counted decimal".
Used to display decimal numbers on §67-Segment Display§7s.
block.rs_ctr2.access_pipe.tip: Inserted into the §fInventory Port§7 of an §6Interaction Pipe Driver§7 for path building.
block.rs_ctr2.pipe_controller.tip:
Lets machines §5interact with distant blocks§7 via a path of §6Interaction Pipe§7 that extends by insertion and retracts by extraction of items through its §finventory port§7.
Extending direction and target block are controlled by §cdata input§7 [t-½].
block.rs_ctr2.item_placer.tip:
Performs an emulated player interaction on the block in front of it, whenever any bit in §9clock§7[t-1] transitions low to high.
§9Settings§7[t-1] controls interaction parameters such as selected Item, aim, crouching, ... (see GUI).
Consumed items are automatically restocked from the §fconnected Inventory§7.
§aError Codes§7: 1 = block unloaded, 2 = action failed/passed, 4 = couldn't restock, 8 = no energy.
block.rs_ctr2.block_breaker.tip:
Breaks the block in front of it whenever any bit in §9clock§7[t-1] transitions low to high.
Harvested items are send to the §fconnected Inventory§7.
§aError Codes§7: 1 = unloaded block, 2 = unbreakable/air, 4 = inventory full, 8 = no energy.
block.rs_ctr2.autocraft.tip:
Automatically crafts items based on a hexadecimal §9pattern§7 that maps the crafting grid slots onto its 16-slot §finternal inventory§7.
Crafting is executed @ t+½ whenever any bit in §9clock§7 transitioned low to high.
§aError Codes§7: 1 = missing ingredients, 2 = invalid recipe, 4 = output slot full, 8 = no energy.
block.rs_ctr2.pipe_controller.ext: Pipe can extend up to %sd blocks.
state.rs_ctr2.item_filter:
§90: §fprovided Inventory
§91: §c%sd§7 extraction mode
§a2: §fhas filtered Path: %ss
§a3: §fhas "else" Path: %ss
item.rs_ctr2.item_counter.tip:
Counts the number of Items in inventory §f⏴§7.
Result §A⏵§7 is updated whenever any bit in §9⏶§7 transitions low to high.
item.rs_ctr2.item_filter.tip:
Items inserted to §f⏵§7 go the filtered path §f⏷§7 if they match any item in the filter, otherwise they go the "else" path §f⏴§7.
Extraction is controlled by §9⏶§7:
-2 = from §f⏷§7, all items as blacklist

-1 = from §f⏷§7, all items as whitelist
0...7 = from §f⏷§7, matching single item
8... = from "else" path §f⏴§7, unfiltered
Filter items are set in GUI (interact with block).
item.rs_ctr2.item_buffer.ext:
Capacity: %sd items per cell
1 unique item per cell.
item.rs_ctr2.item_buffer.tip:
Inserted items are stacked with existing content if possible and different items are stored as "first in first out" queue with a shared stack limit.
Adjacent cells combine.
§f⏺§7 (use item cable) provides inventory.
item.rs_ctr2.data_send.tip:
§9⏵§7 gets send to §a⏵§7 of linked Receiver.
§oYou get the linked §6§oWireless Data Receiver§7§o during initial placement.
item.rs_ctr2.block_send.tip:
§9⏵§7 propagates interaction to §a⏵§7 of linked Receiver.
§oYou get the linked §6§oWireless Block Interaction Receiver§7§o during initial placement.
item.rs_ctr2.item_dropper.tip: §f⏴§7 drops items or picks them up.
item.rs_ctr2.label: Text Label
item.rs_ctr2.label.tip:
Interact with empty hand to edit text.
Interact with Labels on the sides to extend.
Interact with dye to change colors.
§oCrouch placement recommended!
gui.rs_ctr2.label: Label text
block.rs_ctr2.frame.tip:
Must be placed in all 8 (up to 27) corners of the cubiod regions that §6Random Block Access Controller§7s should operate in.
Devices connect to the closest axis aligned Frame block and use the sourrounding regions (up to 8) combined.
block.rs_ctr2.frame.ext: Frames connect up to %sd blocks apart and to machines within %sd blocks.
block.rs_ctr2.frame_controller.tip:
Provides interaction with blocks inside a cuboid region defined by §6Interaction Frame§7s.
The block is selected with 3 supplied §ccoordinate-numbers§7 [t-½] that are relative to the connected origin Frame.
